description: Assesses understanding of complete story structure (story mountain)

levels.4: Engaging exposition that hooks readers while establishing character, setting, and initial situation
levels.2: Some exposition present but missing key elements or not engaging
levels.1: Minimal or no exposition; story starts confusingly

feedback_stems.strength: Your exposition drew me in while setting up the story
feedback_stems.growth: Strengthen your exposition by balancing the hook with necessary background

levels.4: Clear complications that build tension; each event raises stakes
levels.3: Events build toward climax with some tension
levels.2: Events present but don't clearly build or create minimal tension
levels.1: No clear rising action; events are flat

feedback_stems.strength: Your rising action built tension effectively, especially
feedback_stems.growth: Add complications that make the problem worse before it gets better

levels.4: Clear, powerful turning point; highest tension moment is unmistakable
levels.3: Climax is identifiable and represents story's high point
levels.2: Climax is unclear or doesn't feel like the most important moment
levels.1: No clear climax; story lacks a turning point

feedback_stems.growth: Make your climax the most intense moment—this is where everything changes

levels.4: Natural wind-down after climax; satisfying resolution that addresses main conflict
levels.3: Story winds down and concludes appropriately
levels.2: Ending feels rushed or doesn't fully resolve the conflict

feedback_stems.growth: After the climax, give readers a chance to see how things settle

levels.4: Pacing feels intentional; scenes get appropriate time based on importance
levels.2: Pacing issues—some parts too rushed, others drag

feedback_stems.strength: Your pacing worked well, especially how you
feedback_stems.growth: Spend more time on important moments and less on transitions
